text: Statement 1: Patent is an exclusive monopoly right conferred by the government. Statement 2: A patent is granted for a period of 10 years.

Statement 2: A play-cum-educational device which comprises of a chart, a set of tokens for players and one or more dice is a patentable subject matter.
In order to be granted a patent, an invention must satisfy which of the following conditions?
What of the following rights do not need a registration to be enforced?
The patent owner shall enjoy the monopoly right for his/her invention for a maximum period of
options: Initially granted for 10 years then can be renewed
12 years from the date of filing of the application
Life of the inventor plus 20 years
20 years from the date of filing of the application
answers: 20 years from the date of filing of the application

text: Who among the following can apply for a patent?
options: Assignee of the true and first inventor
Legal representative of the true and first inventor
Legal representative of any deceased person
answers: Assignee of the true and first inventor
Legal representative of any deceased person

text: Which of the following inventions can be patented as per Section 3 of the Patents Act, 1970?
options: A device used for executing human beings
Isomers and salts of an earlier patented drug

text: Which of these are types of a patent application that can be filed under the Indian Patent Act?
A complete specification for a patent has to be filed within _______

options: Are not patentable according to section 4
Can be granted a patent for 5 years
Can be granted a patent for 7 years
answers: Are not patentable according to section 4
